node.title: International airlines slow flight bookings to NZ due to high fuel price, low load
node.description: Forward bookings by international air travellers have gone soft after the initial spike, following last month's easing of border restrictions.

node.title: Will the U.S. receive Ukrainian refugees?
node.description: The Russian invasion of Ukraine has triggered the swiftest refugee displacement crisis in Europe since World War II, prompting more than 2.5 million people to flee the country.

node.title: Pakistan warns arch-rival India over mystery flying object
node.description: Pakistan on Friday warned New Delhi of "unpleasant consequences" over what it said was an Indian-originated, but unidentified high-altitude supersonic object that crashed in Pakistani territory.

node.title: ICE arrests and deportations plunged in 2021 under Biden rules
node.description: Current rules instruct ICE officers to detain immigrants convicted of serious crimes, migrants who recently crossed a U.S. border illegally, and those deemed to pose a national security risk, such as suspected terrorists.

node.title: Opioid victims face Purdue owners in hope of closure
node.description: "The screaming will haunt you for the rest of your life," said one mother of a baby that was born addicted to opioids.

node.title: Recipe: Apple Hamantaschen from Breads Bakery
node.description: The New York bakery offers "Sunday Morning" viewers its take on a favorite treat for the Jewish holiday of Purim.

node.title: "Pause" needed in Iran nuclear talks, EU foreign policy chief says
node.description: The comments come as a roadmap appeared imminent for the U.S. to rejoin an accord it unilaterally withdrew from in 2018.

node.title: New Hampshire kids' mini boat found in Norway
node.description: Its GPS only worked sporadically, but after months at sea, the tiny boat landed in Norway – covered in barnacles and its sail missing, but with the notes inside still intact.

node.title: Will Smith on forgiving his father, thoughts of suicide, and "King Richard"
node.description: Preview: In a revealing, emotional interview for "CBS Sunday Morning," the Academy Award-nominee talks with Gayle King about his childhood, and the shocking realization that came with the passing of his father.

node.title: Woman records Ukraine invasion in online "war coffee" diary
node.description: Before the war began, Yaroslava Antipina had a normal life in Kyiv. Today, her entire life is packed into a small suitcase.

node.title: Stocks mixed after Putin cites "positive" talks with Ukraine
node.description: Biden administration is revoking Russia's special trade status in a move to further pressure the country's economy.

node.title: A dart-like device may help police prevent dangerous car chases
node.description: Police are using a unique tracking device that propels a dart-like cartridge from the front of a squad car onto the rear of a suspected stolen vehicle.

node.title: Ukraine says Russia planning "terrorist attack" on Chernobyl
node.description: The dire warning, which U.S. and international atomic energy officials have not confirmed, says Putin personally ordered "preparation" for an attack on the notorious site.

node.title: Woman injured in Ukraine hospital shelling gives birth to daughter
node.description: Mariana Vishegirskaya gave birth after surviving a Russian airstrike on a children's and maternity hospital in Mariupol.

node.title: Watch Live: Biden announces U.S. will revoke Russia's trade status
node.description: The move, in tandem with European Union and G7 countries, will enable the U.S. and allies to impose tariffs on Russian imports.

node.title: The future of American infrastructure
node.description: Secretary of Transportation Pete Buttigieg says money from the $1.2 trillion infrastructure law will fund projects to fix and improve America's ailing roads and bridges.

node.title: Ben Renick murder: Inside the case
node.description: Renick, a "rock star" of the reptile world, was found dead in June 2017. Investigators initially suspected one of his prized serpents had killed him, but they realized something more heinous was responsible.

node.title: Video shows stolen yacht crashing into boats in harbor chase
node.description: After hitting a sailboat, the yacht backed up, circled and continued through the harbor until it hit another parked vessel — then slammed into a wall beside a bridge.

node.title: Salvation Army paid some workers as little as $1 a week, suits claim
node.description: Three federal lawsuits claim residents of work-focused rehab centers do "grueling manual labor" for pennies per hour.

node.title: New analysis links timbers to legendary Pilgrim-era shipwreck
node.description: The new analysis provides the best evidence yet that they belonged to the ill-fated vessel that wrecked on Cape Cod in 1626.

node.title: U.S. responds to "serious escalation" of North Korean missile tests
node.description: Pentagon enhancing intelligence gathering and missile defense readiness in the region after Kim Jong Un regime tests components for a huge new missile.

node.title: Snake suspected in man's death until cops realize it can't pull trigger
node.description: Investigators thought snake breeder Ben Renick was killed by a reptile — until they discovered "bite marks" were bullet wounds.

node.title: Russia may be set to extend brutal siege tactics to Ukraine's capital
node.description: Those hoping the worst wouldn't come to Kyiv can't ignore Russia's seemingly merciless bombardment of major cities, and a column of ground forces seemingly on the move again.

node.title: Putin may be committing war crimes, but do the allegations have any teeth?
node.description: The case against Putin could come together quickly, but a conviction could be more elusive.

node.title: 83-year-old man charged after woman's head found in NYC apartment
node.description: Harvey Marcelin was arrested after being recorded on surveillance video abandoning a bag later found to contain the victim's torso.

node.title: Mayor shot dead in Mexico drug war flashpoint
node.description: Aguililla mayor Cesar Valencia was shot dead by unknown attackers while traveling in a city hall vehicle near a soccer field in the town.

node.title: Possible fentanyl OD lands 6 spring breakers in Florida hospitals
node.description: It happened in an Airbnb in the Fort Lauderdale area. One of the six students was in critical condition. Authorities said four apparently ingested fentanyl-laced cocaine and the other two were affected when they tried to perform CPR.

node.title: Divers search "gator-infested waters" after body parts found
node.description: "We can't rule out the possibility that somebody fell in the water and died of natural causes out here, but it doesn't look like that to us," the sheriff said.

node.title: Rep. Mike Quigley on Ukraine - "The Takeout"
node.description: On "The Takeout" podcast this week, Rep. Mike Quigley says the U.S. should be doing more to help Ukrainians.

node.title: Second arrest in alleged theft of 84-year-old's home and life savings
node.description: Authorities say the two suspects -- one of whom was a funeral home worker-- took advantage of the elderly victim after his wife died in August 2019, telling him they were family.
